Top 10 for the 4th time. That's a victory. Artistic freedom and people that appreciate it. Victory. 117k first week. Room to grow.
You can't win all the time. You'd never learn anything. GOD doesn't work that way (I don't think) the bumps in the road are chances to learn
So if this album doesn't do as well as my others, it's not a failure or a loss. It's art for those who get it and opportunity to grow...
You can't do TRUE art with the intention of pleasing everyone, a hard lesson learned for me. True art touches those it's MEANT to touch....
The beauty of being an artist is expansion and growth. But understanding that not everyone is gonna like it, is part of that growth....
I love that there are people that sing better, dance better, make more money, sell more albums...it gives me new goals to reach...
I love the fact that some people understand my music and some don't. It let's me know that tho individuality is fleeting, it still exists...
I LOVE those that love me and love my art. They let me know that tho my vision sometimes isn't for everyone, those that get it GET IT....
I luv people that wanna see me fail. They motivate me in a way nothing else can. They become the reason I improve, the reason I excel...
Thank you all for AGAIN reminding me why I do this. Record labels sell records, I MAKE MUSIC. Shouts to the music lovers out there. SEE YOU!

Anything you do with passion, you're probably gonna do well, and SOMEBODY will pay you for it. Create with passion in mind, not a paycheck.

#selfquestion: Why is passion so often mistaken for anger or insanity? What's the difference, IS there a difference? Ask yourself...
...So I'm not mad. You live, learn and adapt. And that's exactly what I plan to do. LOVE to those that love me, and even those that don't!!!
...I am a man who tries to learn from my mistakes and improve with every season of life. It's all we can really control....
...In that same moment I realized the real reason that I do this, and defeated my anger. My positive wins out in the end...
If you put work and precious time into something and someone steals it, you're supposed to be upset. So for a moment I was....for a moment..
It's funny to me that of all the relative and positive tweets I sent in that rant, the one that got the most attention was the negative one.
Sincerely yours, a rather frustrated yet at mental peace, Ne*Yo!! Much luv to my fans AND my haters.
...I'LL BE DAMNED IF YOU HACKER FUCKS GET MY NEXT ALBUM BEFORE IT'S TIME!!! FUCK YOU ALL!!!! Have a nice day.
...So with that twit fam and haters alike, I bid you farewell for now, and leave you with this....
...I'm not solely in the business of selling records. I'm in the business of making art. That's what an artist does, period...
...Ether way, the music, the concept, the whole lot, served it's purpose. It gave the people something quality to vibe to...
...So if you as a fan give a damn about me, buy the album when it comes out. If you don't care, go get it off the internet. Your choice...
...The bottom line is, I worked hard on this project. The music, the concept, the whole lot is for the people, respect or not...
...So with that said, I've come to this place of mental peace. No longer stressing people that steal the music, how it'll effect my sales...
...In a time where people buy their status and falsify their success, can those things really be that important to me? The answer is no...
...However, my love for music and it's effect on people, outweighs my desire to simply sell records, or get that number one debut spot...
...To sell records, make money, or is it because I love it, love how it touches people, how it helps people? The honest answer is both...
...Initially this angered me. It's stealing plain n' simple. But then I started thinking. Why do I make music....?
...But it has been brought to my attention that my album was hacked and leaked in the U.S. roughly a month before it's U.S. release...

I'll let the others do it for money, power and fame,
I'll forever stay true to my art.........for that alone is my lane.
Thanx for listenin'

I do this for the love of art, this is my aim,
tho this celebrity life sometimes goes against that grain.....

This has never been a ploy to uplift my name,
down play another or even make a lil' change......

The fact is I do music and my peace it maintains,
I feel without it, I'd surely go insane.......

And this opinion I have the right to proclaim,
with no apology, not a bit of shame.....

I speak how I feel with no hatred or disdain,
and my opinion is mine, simple and plain......

By no means am I the best in the game,
not my decision to make, nor my crown to claim......

Lately this business of music ain't the same,
some of it is good, most of it is lame.......

Music is of the heart, greed is of the brain,
the LAST reason to create art? Fame.....

There's music in the blood that flows thru these veins,
pleasure in the lyric, melody in the pain.......

TO MY FELLOW ARTISTS OUT THERE: Why do you do it? Money, fame, love?
What's your motivation to do this thing called "Music"?
I just take music so personally because it is LITERALLY my life. Fame can be fun, but if there was NO fame I'd STILL make music.
I think I may be too critical of music. Maybe there's room for ALL of it, good and bad. I mean how do you know the good if not for the bad?
